ygData.subject: RE: possible big cheat for EQ....
ygData.msgSnippet: Here is a hint. If you modify files in the EQ directory, the patch program will catch them and delete them but if you delete the eqnews.txt file and run the
ygData.messageBody:
Here is a hint. If you modify files in the EQ directory, the patch program
will catch them and delete them but if you delete the eqnews.txt file and
run the patch, eq will download the news and print it out on screen. It then
leaves a play now button but you can still use windows. Now you can modify
files. I was also thinking that if you were to rename the air plane files to
the files for another zone durring this time and hit play now, would you be
able to zone into the air plane?

Trevalien


>From: "Whitcraft,David" <DWHITCRAFT@...>
>Reply-To: EQCheats@onelist.com
>To: "'EQCheats@onelist.com'" <EQCheats@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [EQCheats] possible big cheat for EQ....
>Date: Mon, 23 Aug 1999 13:25:23 -0500
>
>From: "Whitcraft,David" <DWHITCRAFT@...>
>
>Hey, the two monitors is an interesting idea... Win 98 supports dual
>monitors, I've seen it done back in Beta when we were testing it.... I also
>work coding programs for DINPACS systems, which often use 2 or more HIGH
>(2400x2000) res monitors... Now, given the way EQ works, I DOUBT that EQ
>would come up on one screen and the other would be the rest of the desktop,
>but it MIGHT be possible to get to work, I'm not sure.
>
>Anyone tried this?
>
>Also, I wonder if you could write a program that would send a windows
>message to EQ that would minimize or 'restore' (take to a smaller window)
>EQ. Now, THAT might be worth investigating... Anyone tried this? I could
>probably figure out a way to find the handle for the EQ window and have a
>program runing in the background automatically send it a restore message
>after EQ loads... Wouldn't that be cool....
>
>-Leod
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Omeg Felligan [mailto:omeg_felligan@...]
>Sent: Thursday, August 19, 1999 8:04 AM
>To: EQCheats@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQCheats] possible big cheat for EQ....
>
>
>From: "Omeg Felligan" <omeg_felligan@...>
>
>I think one thing that ppl are ignoreing is that EQ logs you off if you
>alt-tab out, and that your computer all but freezes up...but whatever.
>
>also there doesn't seem to be any way to float anything above EQ while in
>game (I've tried ICQ's floating thingy, didn't work). so you'd have to
>write a hack to over come this and I'm guessing that would be entirely
>client side...either that or have 2 monitors ;)
>
>so even if cheat programs were developed (yeah right) than how would you
>even get to them?
>
>Omeg
>
>
